IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: THE APOLLO THEATER IS A COMMISSIONER AND PRESENTER; CATALYST FOR NEW ARTISTS, AUDIENCES, AND CREATIVE WORKFORCE; AND PARTNER IN THE PROJECTION OF THE AFRICAN AMERICAN NARRATIVE AND ITS ROLE IN THE DEVELOPMENT OF AMERICAN AND GLOBAL CULTURE.
IRS990.MissionDesc: THE APOLLO THEATER IS A COMMISSIONER AND PRESENTER; CATALYST FOR NEW ARTISTS, AUDIENCES, AND CREATIVE WORKFORCE; AND PARTNER IN THE PROJECTION OF THE AFRICAN AMERICAN NARRATIVE AND ITS ROLE IN THE DEVELOPMENT OF AMERICAN AND GLOBAL CULTURE. THE APOLLO THEATER ENVISIONS A NEW AMERICAN CANON CENTERED ON CONTRIBUTIONS TO THE PERFORMING ARTS BY ARTISTS OF THE AFRICAN DIASPORA, IN AMERICA AND BEYOND.
IRS990.Desc: 2017-2018 PERFORMING ARTS PROGRAMSTHE APOLLO'S 84TH SEASON FEATURED ARTISTIC PROGRAMS THAT SPANNED MUSIC, OPERA, DANCE, THEATER, AND COMEDY. THE APOLLO HOUSES TWO PERFORMANCE SPACES - ITS WORLD-FAMOUS 1,500-SEAT MAINSTAGE THEATER AND FLEXIBLE 180-SEAT SOUNDSTAGE SPACE. A LANDMARKED BUILDING, THE APOLLO IS MORE THAN JUST A VENUE, IT IS A VIBRANT PRODUCER, COMMISSIONER, PRESENTING ORGANIZATION, AND HOME FOR ARTISTS AT ALL STAGES OF THEIR CAREER. THE APOLLO IS ESPECIALLY KNOWN AS, "THE PLACE WHERE STARS ARE BORN AND LEGENDS ARE MADE", SERVING AS A PLATFORM FOR ESTABLISHED ARTISTS, NURTURING EMERGING AND MID-CAREER PERFORMERS AS WELL AS NEW WORK DEVELOPMENT ACROSS DISCIPLINES. ... CONTINUED ON SCHEDULE O 2017-2018 SEASON HIGHLIGHTS INCLUDED: THE RETURN OF BREAKIN CONVENTION INTERNATIONAL HIP HOP THEATER DANCE FESTIVAL; THE NEW YORK PREMIERE OF WE SHALL NOT BE MOVED, A NEW OPERA; THE WORLD PREMIERE OF BETWEEN THE WORLD AND ME, A DRAMATIC INTERPRETATION OF TA-NEHISI COATES'S POWERFUL NOVEL OF THE SAME NAME. THE APOLLO ALSO COLLABORATED WITH ESTEEMED ORGANIZATIONS INCLUDING WNYC, THE JOHN F. KENNEDY CENTER FOR THE PERFORMING ARTS, SADLER'S WELLS AND OPERA PHILADELPHIA.UNIQUE TO THE FY18 SEASON, THE APOLLO'S CURATORIAL APPROACH SHIFTED FROM BEING SIMPLY A PRESENTER TO BEING A PROVOCATIVE INSTIGATOR AND ARTISTIC LEADER. UNDER THE LEADERSHIP OF THE NEW EXECUTIVE PRODUCER, KAMILAH FORBES, THE APOLLO HAS TAKEN AN ACTIVE ROLE IN EMPOWERING ARTISTS AS ACTIVISTS AND BUILDING ON THE APOLLO'S INCREDIBLE LEGACY AS A TOUCHSTONE FOR THE AFRICAN-AMERICAN COMMUNITY AND A NURTURING HOME FOR DIVERSE ARTISTS WITH PROGRAMS THAT FOCUS ON SOCIAL JUSTICE.APOLLO MUSICAPOLLO MUSIC IS A PROGRAM INITIATIVE DESIGNED TO RECLAIM AND EXPAND OUR NICHE IN THE POPULAR MUSIC ARENA, PROMOTE THE WORK OF A BROADER MIX OF ARTISTS, AND BETTER SERVE OUR COMMUNITY AND DIVERSE AUDIENCE BASE. IT ALLOWS US TO CELEBRATE OUR RICH LEGACY, AS WELL AS THE ROOTS OF OUR HARLEM COMMUNITY. IN FEBRUARY, THE APOLLO PRESENTED SOUNDTRACK '63, A MULTI-MEDIA, LIVE MUSIC PERFORMANCE THAT TRANSPORTED THE AUDIENCE BACK IN TIME WITH A CULTURAL AND ARTISTIC RETROSPECTIVE OF THE CIVIL RIGHTS MOVEMENT FROM 1963 THRU TO THE PRESENT DAY BLACK LIVES MATTER MOVEMENT CREATED BY SOUL SCIENCE LAB DUO, CHEN LO, AND ASANTE AMIN. SOUNDTRACK '63 ARTISTICALLY PORTRAYED THE UNTOLD AND UNDER-TOLD STORIES OF CIVIL RIGHTS HISTORY AND THE BLACK EXPERIENCE IN AMERICA. THE PRODUCTION FEATURES SPIRITUALS, PROTEST SONGS, AND POPULAR MUSIC THROUGHOUT THE 20TH CENTURY PERFORMED BY A LIVE 18-PIECE ORCHESTRA AND DYNAMIC VOCAL CHAMBER. A CAPTIVATING VIDEO INSTALLATION OF ARCHIVAL FOOTAGE AND ANIMATION SERVED AS THE BACKDROP FOR THE SOUNDTRACK, WITH COMMENTARY BY DR. CORNEL WEST, RENOWNED POETS SONIA SANCHEZ, AND LIVE PERFORMANCES FROM ABIODUN OYEWOLE OF THE LAST POETS, AND LEON BRIDGES.MARCH 3, 2018, THE APOLLO PRESENTED ITS 6TH ANNUAL AFRICA NOW! CONCERT IN PARTNERSHIP WITH WORLD MUSIC INSTITUTE, CELEBRATING THE BEST OF TODAY'S AFRICAN MUSIC SCENE. THIS YEAR'S CONCERT SPOTLIGHTED THE CONTINENT'S CONTEMPORARY TRENDS IN ELECTRONIC MUSIC, AND ARTISTS INCLUDED: BLACK COFFEE (SOUTH AFRICA); TONY ALLEN & JEFF MILLS(NIGERIA); AND PIERRE KWENDERS (DEMOCRATIC REPUBLIC OF THE CONGO). APOLLO DANCEWITH A NEWFOUND EMPHASIS ON HIP HOP, DANCE THEATRE AND TAP, APOLLO DANCE CREATES, PRESENTS LARGE-SCALE PROJECTS, AS WELL AS CO-PRESENTS AND COMMISSIONS NEW WORK FROM SELECT COMPANIES AND INDIVIDUAL CHOREOGRAPHERS. THE APOLLO'S SIGNATURE SALON SERIES FOCUSES ON NEW, MULTI-DISCIPLINARY WORK THROUGH DEVELOPMENTAL WORKSHOPS AND PERFORMANCES.OCTOBER 20-28, 2017, THE APOLLO PRESENTED BREAKIN CONVENTION, CURATED AND HOSTED BY SADLER'S WELLS ASSOCIATE ARTIST JONZI D. BREAKIN CONVENTION RETURNED TO THE APOLLO WITH ANOTHER PACKED PROGRAM AND FEATURED THE BEST AND BRIGHTEST HIP-HOP DANCE COMPANIES FROM AROUND THE CORNER AND AROUND THE WORLD. THE APOLLO CELEBRATES THE GLOBAL IMPACT OF ITS HIP HOP ROOTS WITH EVERYTHING FROM MAINSTREAM TO EXPERIMENTAL DANCE, AND SHOWCASED ALL THE HALLMARKS OF THE GENRE: EXPLOSIVE ENERGY, INTRICATE STEP SEQUENCES, SYNCHRONICITY, AND CHOREOGRAPHY.INTERNATIONAL PERFORMERS INCLUDED THE LEGENDARY SALAH AND YEAH YELLOW OF FRANCE, SOUTH AFRICA'S SOWETO SKELETON MOVERS, AND THE UK'S PROTOCOL. FROM NEW YORK, IT'S THE LEGENDARY DYNAMIC ROCKERS, REP YOUR STYLE, HARLEM'S OWN BWRECKFAST CLUB FROM LITEFEET NATION, PASSION FRUIT DANCE COMPANY, HAVOC & KLASSIC. SPILLING OFF STAGE AND TAKING OVER THE WHOLE BUILDING, WORKSHOPS, GRAFFITI, DJS, AND DANCE BATTLES MADE BREAKIN' CONVENTION UNLIKE ANY OTHER DANCE FESTIVAL IN THE WORLD. EXHIBITIONS, MASTER CLASSES, ARTIST TALKS, AND WORKSHOPS WERE SCHEDULED THROUGHOUT THE WEEK, WITH A SPECIAL SCHOOL DAY LIVE PERFORMANCE ON OCTOBER 27 AND A FAMILY WORKSHOP ON THE 28TH.DECEMBER 1-2, 2017, THE APOLLO ONCE AGAIN PRESENTED BALLET HISPANICO'S ANNUAL UPTOWN SEASON, WHICH FEATURED THREE DANCE PIECES INCLUDING ONE CO-COMMISSIONED BY THE APOLLO. ESPIRITU VIVO, CHOREOGRAPHED BY RONALD K. BROWN, EXPLORED THE INTERSECTION OF THE AFRICAN AND LATINO DIASPORAS IN THE CARIBBEAN AND LATIN AMERICA. BURY ME STANDING, BY SPANISH CHOREOGRAPHER RAMON OLLER, LOOKED AT THE UNIQUE CULTURE OF THE GYPSY OR "ROMA" PEOPLE, A MARGINALIZED COMMUNITY THAT JOURNEYED ACROSS CONTINENTS FOR THOUSANDS OF YEARS. IN HER FIRST WORK FOR BALLET HISPANICO, MICHELLE MANZANALES EXPLORED WITH HUMILITY, NOSTALGIA, AND HUMOR THE ICONIC MEXICAN SYMBOLS THAT SHE WAS RELUCTANT TO EMBRACE AS A MEXICAN-AMERICAN CHILD GROWING UP IN TEXAS IN A WORK ENTITLED CON BRAZOS ABIERTOS. THERE WERE TWO SCHOOL DAY LIVES DURING THIS ENGAGEMENT, ONE ARTIST TALK BACK WITH MICHELLE MANZANALES, AND A FAMILY WORKSHOP ON DECEMBER 2.THE APOLLO THEATER CELEBRATED KWANZAA WITH ITS POPULAR ANNUAL SHOW FEATURING THE RENOWNED NEW YORK-BASED DANCE COMPANY, ABDEL SALAAM'S FORCES OF NATURE DANCE THEATER WITH SPECIAL GUESTS LES NUBIANS. THE APOLLO'S CELEBRATION WAS A JOYFUL EVENING OF DANCE AND MUSIC HONORING THE PRINCIPLES OF KWANZAA-FAMILY, COMMUNITY, AND CULTURE. THE APOLLO'S 12TH ANNUAL KWANZAA CELEBRATION FEATURED TWO DANCE PERFORMANCES ON DECEMBER 30, 2017.IN ITS 11TH YEAR, THE APOLLO SALON SERIES EXTENDED THE THEATER'S LEGACY OF NURTURING MID-CAREER AND ESTABLISHED ARTISTS BY PROVIDING CRITICAL SUPPORT IN THEIR CREATION OF NEW WORK ACROSS ARTISTIC DISCIPLINES. IT ALSO PROVIDED A TESTING GROUND FOR NEW LARGE-SCALE PROJECTS THAT MIGHT BE PRESENTED ON THE APOLLO'S MAINSTAGE OR ELSEWHERE, AND DEVELOPED NEW AUDIENCES. IN 2017-2018, THE APOLLO WELCOMED DANCER/CHOREOGRAPHER DUO LIL BUCK & JON BOOGZ. THESE PERFORMERS USE HIP HOP DANCE STYLES AS A TOOL FOR SOCIAL ACTIVISM, AND WORKED ON A NEW PIECE AT THE APOLLO.APOLLO SPECIAL PROJECTS THE 2017-2018 SEASON OPENED WITH THE MUCH-ANTICIPATED GENRE DEFYING, SPOKEN WORD OPERA CO-COMMISSIONED AND CO-PRODUCED BY THE APOLLO ENTITLED, WE SHALL NOT BE MOVED. THIS OPERA IS PART OF THE APOLLO'S MULTI-YEAR PARTNERSHIP WITH OPERA PHILADELPHIA, WHICH WAS LAUNCHED WITH CHARLIE PARKER'S YARDBIRD IN APRIL 2016. THE CREATIVE TEAM INCLUDED: MUSIC BY DANIEL BERNARD ROUMAIN; LIBRETTO BY MARC BAMUTHI JOSEPH; AND DIRECTOR/CHOREOGRAPHER/DRAMATURG BY BILL T. JONES. OCTOBER 6-7, 2017, WE SHALL NOT BE MOVED MADE ITS NY PREMIERE WITH TWO PERFORMANCES. THERE WAS ALSO AN OPEN DRESS REHEARSAL HELD ON OCTOBER 5 THAT WAS FREE TO ATTENDEES, AND THE AUDIENCE WAS MADE UP OF LOCAL SCHOOLS AND COMMUNITY GROUPS. ADDITIONALLY, AND UPTOWN HALL COMMUNITY PROGRAM ENTITLED "MOVEMENT REQUIRED" WAS PRESENTED PRIOR TO THE ENGAGEMENT SO THAT THERE WAS CONTEXT FOR THIS OPERA.LATER IN OCTOBER, THE APOLLO CO-PRESENTED A DRAMATIZATION OF THE NOVELS BY OCTAVIA E. BUTLER'S PARABLE OF THE SOWER, CREATED FOR THE STAGE BY TOSHI REAGON AND BERNICE JOHNSON REAGON. THIS OPERA WAS PERFORMED ON THE APOLLO'S SOUNDSTAGE OCTOBER 16.IN THE SPRING, THE APOLLO PRESENTED THE WORLD PREMIERE OF BETWEEN THE WORLD AND ME, A MULTIMEDIA PERFORMANCE EVENT BRINGING TA-NAHESI COATES'S AWARD-WINNING BOOK TO THE STAGE THROUGH MUSIC, DRAMA, AND VIDEO. UNDER THE ARTISTIC DIRECTION OF APOLLO EXECUTIVE PRODUCER KAMILAH FORBES, AND KENNEDY CENTER ARTISTIC DIRECTOR OF JAZZ AND MACARTHUR GENIUS AWARD RECIPIENT JASON MORAN, THIS PRODUCTION INCLUDED 12 PERFORMERS (MUSICIANS, ACTORS, AND READERS) AND FEATURED NEWLY COMPOSED MUSIC BY MR. MORAN, NEWLY IMAGINED DRAMATURGY AND DIRECTION BY MS. FORBES, AND INTERACTIVE PRODUCTION/VISUAL STORYTELLING. THE LIVE PERFORMANCE EVENT WAS A PRESENTATION OF EXCERPTED SELECTIONS, READ MONOLOGUE-STYLE BY NOTABLE GUEST ARTISTS INTERSPERSED WITH MUSIC AND VISUAL PROJECTION DESIGN. THE PERFORMANCE WAS AN OPPORTUNITY TO EXTEND THE CONVERSATION AROUND RACE AND POLITICS IN AMERICA THROUGH PERFORMANCE. A LIVE WIRE EDUCATION PROGRAM WAS HELD IN APRIL ABOUT THIS PRODUCTION.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: EDUCATION AND COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENTEDUCATION AND COMMUNITY PROGRAMS EXTEND THE APOLLO THEATER'S COMMITMENT TO ENHANCING THE LIFE IN HARLEM AND ITS SURROUNDING NEIGHBORHOODS. HIGH-CALIBER ARTISTIC PRESENTATIONS AND INNOVATIVE LEARNING PROGRAMS PROVIDE TRANSFORMATIVE EXPERIENCES FOR YOUTH, AND MEANINGFUL ENGAGEMENT FOR THE COMMUNITY PARTICULARLY REACHING COMMUNITIES LIKE THE AFRICAN-AMERICAN, LATINO, AND YOUNG LOCAL AUDIENCES OF HARLEM, WHICH ARE HISTORICALLY UNDERSERVED BY THE PERFORMING ARTS. NEARLY 30,000 PEOPLE PARTICIPATE IN THESE PROGRAMS EACH YEAR. APOLLO EDUCATION THE APOLLO'S EDUCATION PROGRAMS ENGAGE YOUNG AUDIENCES, FURTHER THE THEATER'S 80+ YEAR LEGACY, SUPPORT THE DIVERSE INTERESTS OF ITS VISITORS, AND INSPIRE A LIFE-LONG LOVE OF THE ARTS WITH BOTH IN-DEPTH AND EXPERIENTIAL OPPORTUNITIES. THIS PROGRAMMING SERVES A BROAD AUDIENCE OF SCHOOL-AGE CHILDREN, TEENS, ADULTS, AND ASPIRING MUSICIANS AND ARTISTS. ANNUAL PROGRAMS INCLUDE: - HIGH SCHOOL INTERNSHIP PROGRAM- HANDS-ON EXPERIENCES IN ARTS MANAGEMENT AND TECHNICAL THEATER FOR 20 HIGH-SCHOOL STUDENTS IN THE FALL, SPRING, AND SUMMER SESSIONS. - ORAL HISTORY PROJECT- SEQUENTIAL, CURRICULUM-BASED PARTNERSHIPS WITH LOCAL MIDDLE AND HIGH SCHOOLS (C.S. 154 AND WADLEIGH SECONDARY SCHOOL FOR THE PERFORMING & VISUAL ARTS) THAT CAPTURED THE ORAL HISTORIES OF COMMUNITY LEADERS, AND RE-TOLD BY THE 150 PARTICIPATING STUDENTS THROUGH THE THEATER AND VIDEO DOCUMENTARY MEDIUMS. - IN-SCHOOL WORKSHOPS AND RESIDENCIES- APOLLO EDUCATORS REACHED 2,500 STUDENTS IN NEW YORK CITY SCHOOLS WITH DIFFERENT 45-60 MINUTE PROGRAMS THAT FOCUS ON DANCE, THEATER, AND MUSIC AS ONE-TIME VISITS OR SEMESTER-LONG RESIDENCIES. - HISTORIC AND SCHOOL TOURS- MORE THAN 15,000 PEOPLE VISITED THE APOLLO FOR A TOUR OF THE WORLD-FAMOUS THEATER. SCHOOL TOURS HAVE SEVERAL DIFFERENT TOPICS THAT EXPLORE SPECIFIC ASPECTS OF THE APOLLO'S PLACE IN HISTORY. - SCHOOL DAY LIVE- THIS PROGRAM IS GREATLY EXPANDING, AND THERE WERE SEVEN (7) SPECIAL MAINSTAGE PERFORMANCES, REACHING MORE THAN 7,000 K-12TH GRADE STUDENTS, DURING THE SCHOOL DAY IN FY18. - FAMILY SHOWTIME AND WORKSHOPS- FOUR CUSTOMIZED PERFORMANCES AND ACTIVITIES FOR MORE THAN 150 YOUNG CHILDREN AND FAMILIES. - LIVE WIRE/ CAREER PANELS AND WORKSHOPS/MASTER CLASSES -CAREER AND LEADERSHIP SKILLS SEMINARS FOR BOTH PERFORMANCE AND NON-PERFORMANCE RELATED ARTS CAREERS FOR MORE THAN 400 YOUNG PEOPLE. APOLLO COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT PROGRAMSTHROUGH A VARIETY OF INTERACTIVE PROGRAMS DESIGNED TO ENGAGE CHILDREN, ADULTS, SCHOOLS, FAMILIES, ARTISTS, AND COMMUNITY-BASED ORGANIZATIONS, OUTREACH ACTIVITIES BUILD ON THE APOLLO'S RICH HISTORY AS A CULTURAL AND ECONOMIC ANCHOR IN GREATER HARLEM. IN ADDITION TO PARTICIPATING IN NEIGHBORHOOD FESTIVALS LIKE HARLEM WEEK (AUGUST), THE APOLLO ANNUALLY HOSTS THREE MAJOR PUBLIC EVENTS IN HARLEM, WITH PROGRAMMING BOTH IN AND OUTSIDE OF THE THEATER: - HOLIDAYS AT THE APOLLO, WHICH INCLUDED THE FREE COCA-COLA WINTER WONDERLAND (DECEMBER 9, 2017), AS WELL AS THE KWANZAA CELEBRATION WITH PERFORMANCES FROM THE FORCES OF NATURE DANCE COMPANY (DECEMBER 30, 2017), WERE AVAILABLE TO ALL WITH FREE AND LOW-COST TICKETS. - UPTOWN HALL IS A FREE AND INTERACTIVE FORUM THAT LEVERAGES THE THEATER'S LONGSTANDING HISTORY AS A COMMUNITY ANCHOR BY FORMALLY POSITIONING THE THEATER AS A GATHERING PLACE FOR CRITICAL COMMUNITY-WIDE DIALOGUE, CONNECTING UPPER MANHATTAN RESIDENTS, PUBLIC OFFICIALS, AN ARRAY OF LOCAL BUSINESSES AND PUBLIC SERVICE AGENCIES AS WELL AS OTHER COMMUNITY STAKEHOLDERS. IN THE 2017 SEASON, THE APOLLO HOSTED TWO UPTOWN HALL PROGRAMS: "MOVEMENT REQUIRED" ON SEPTEMBER 30, 2017; AND THE 5TH ANNUAL MARTIN LUTHER KING DAY TRIBUTE WITH WNYC; JANUARY 14, 2018. - OPEN HOUSE IS WHEN THE APOLLO THEATER OPENS ITS DOORS FOR A FREE WEEKEND OF ACTIVITIES EACH FEBRUARY, IN CELEBRATION OF BLACK HISTORY MONTH. THE OPEN HOUSE WEEKEND EXPLORES DIFFERENT ASPECTS OF THE APOLLO'S LEGACY THAT INCLUDES FILM AND MUSIC PRESENTATIONS DEVOTED TO SPOTLIGHTING LEGENDARY APOLLO ARTISTS, WITH PERFORMANCES BY RISING STARS OF TODAY. IN FY18, THIRTEEN PRESENTED "TELL THEM WE ARE RISING" AS A PART OF THE OPEN HOUSE WEEKEND.

BusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: ARTS MANAGER DEVOS INSTITUTE OF ARTS MA

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE APOLLO THEATER FOUNDATION, INC. RETAINED COZEN O'CONNOR TO LOBBY NEW YORK CITY FOR PUBLIC SUPPORT.

THE THEATER MAINTAINS A COLLECTION OF HISTORICAL PORTRAITS OF LEGENDARY ARTISTS AND EVENTS THAT PERFORMED AND OCCURRED, RESPECTIVELY, AT THE THEATER. THESE PORTRAITS ARE HELD PRIMARILY FOR ARTISTIC AND THEATRICAL PURPOSES.
THE APOLLO'S ENDOWMENT CONSISTS OF AN INDIVIDUAL FUND ESTABLISHED FOR HISTORIC PRESERVATION USE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: PRIOR TO FILING THE FORM 990, THE 1ST REVIEW IS CONDUCTED BY THE AUDIT COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS. THE INDEPENDENT AUDITOR PRESENTS THE FORM 990 TO THE AUDIT COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS AND ANY QUESTIONS AND CONCERNS ARE ADDRESSED. SUBSEQUENTLY THE FORM 990 IS DISTRIBUTED TO THE FULL BOARD OF DIRECTORS FOR FINAL REVIEW AND APPROVAL. UPON APPROVAL OF THE FORM 990 BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS, IT IS FILED WITH THE INTERNAL REVENUE SERVICE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: DISCLOSURE OF CONFLICT. AN INTERESTED PERSON MUST DISCLOSE ORALLY OR IN WRITING THE EXISTENCE OF HIS OR HER INTEREST AND ALL MATERIAL FACTS RELATED TO AN ACTUAL OR POTENTIAL CONFLICT OF INTEREST TO DIRECTORS AND/OR MEMBERS OF COMMITTEES AUTHORIZING A PROPOSED CONTRACT OR OTHER TRANSACTION INVOLVING SUCH CONFLICT OF INTEREST. IF A CONTRACT OR TRANSACTION IS NOT BEING CONSIDERED BY THE BOARD OR A COMMITTEE, THE REQUIRED DISCLOSURE MUST BE MADE TO THE CHAIRMAN OF THE BOARD, CHAIRMAN OF THE AUDIT COMMITTEE, SECRETARY OR THE CHAIRMAN'S DESIGNEE, WHO SHALL, SUBJECT TO THE DISCRETION OF THE CHAIRMAN (WHERE THE INTERESTED PERSON IS NOT THE CHAIRMAN), DISCLOSE SUCH POTENTIAL CONFLICT OF INTEREST TO THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS OR THE AUDIT COMMITTEE. UNTIL A PROPOSED CONTRACT OR OTHER TRANSACTION INVOLVING A CONFLICT OF INTEREST HAS BEEN VOTED UPON BY THE BOARD OR A COMMITTEE, AN INTERESTED PERSON SHALL REFRAIN FROM ANY ACTION THAT MIGHT AFFECT THE FOUNDATION'S PARTICIPATION IN ANY CONTRACT OR TRANSACTION AFFECTED BY SUCH CONFLICT OF INTEREST. AN INTERESTED PERSON MAY NOT VOTE ON THE CONTRACT OR TRANSACTION TO WHICH THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST RELATES, BUT MAY BE COUNTED IN DETERMINING THE PRESENCE OF A QUORUM AT THE MEETING OF THE BOARD OR COMMITTEE THAT AUTHORIZES SUCH CONTRACTS OR TRANSACTIONS. THE BOARD OR COMMITTEE SHALL DETERMINE BY A MAJORITY VOTE OF THE DISINTERESTED DIRECTORS WHETHER A CONFLICT OF INTEREST EXISTS AND, IF SO, WHETHER THE FOUNDATION SHOULD NONETHELESS ENTER INTO THE CONTRACT OR TRANSACTION BECAUSE IT IS IN THE FOUNDATION'S BEST INTEREST. ARTICLE V. VIOLATIONS OF THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY 1.FAILURE TO DISCLOSE CONFLICT. IF THE BOARD OR COMMITTEE HAS GOOD REASON TO BELIEVE THAT AN INTERESTED PERSON HAS FAILED TO DISCLOSE AN ACTUAL OR POTENTIAL CONFLICT OF INTEREST, IT SHALL INFORM THE INTERESTED PERSON OF THE BASIS FOR SUCH BELIEF AND AFFORD THE INTERESTED PERSON AN OPPORTUNITY TO EXPLAIN THE ALLEGED FAILURE TO DISCLOSE PRIOR TO THE BOARD OR SUCH COMMITTEE TAKING ANY ACTION WITH RESPECT TO THE CONTRACT OR OTHER TRANSACTION INVOLVING A CONFLICT OF INTEREST. 2.DISCIPLINARY ACTION. IF, AFTER HEARING THE RESPONSE OF THE INTERESTED PERSON AND MAKING ANY FURTHER INVESTIGATION AS MAY BE WARRANTED IN THE CIRCUMSTANCES, THE BOARD OR COMMITTEE DETERMINES THAT THE MEMBER HAS IN FACT FAILED TO DISCLOSE AN ACTUAL OR POTENTIAL CONFLICT OF INTEREST, THE BOARD OR SUCH COMMITTEE MAY TAKE APPROPRIATE DISCIPLINARY AND CORRECTIVE ACTION, WHICH MAY INCLUDE REMOVAL OF A DIRECTOR FROM THE BOARD OR A COMMITTEE OR TERMINATION OF AN EMPLOYEE'S EMPLOYMENT. EACH INTERESTED PERSON SHALL ANNUALLY SIGN A STATEMENT WHICH AFFIRMS THAT SUCH PERSON HAS RECEIVED A COPY OF THE POLICY, HAS READ AND UNDERSTANDS THE POLICY AND HAS AGREED TO COMPLY WITH THE POLICY. IN ADDITION, EACH INTERESTED PERSON SHALL DISCLOSE ON SUCH ANNUAL STATEMENT ANY RELATIONSHIPS, CIRCUMSTANCES OR POSITIONS IN WHICH THE INTERESTED PERSON OR A FAMILY MEMBER IS INVOLVED THAT HE OR SHE BELIEVES COULD RESULT IN, CAUSE OR CONTRIBUTE TO A CONFLICT OF INTEREST ARISING. THE POLICY IS REVIEWED ANNUALLY BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS OR THE AUDIT COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE INDEPENDENT COMPENSATION COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD REVIEWS AND APPROVES THE EXECUTIVE LEVEL SALARIES ON AN ANNUAL BASIS. THEY USE SALARY SURVEYS FROM SIMILAR SIZED ORGANIZATIONS WITHIN THE PERFORMING ARTS INDUSTRY FOR BENCHMARKING. OTHER THAN THESE EXECUTIVE LEVEL EMPLOYEES, NO OTHER EMPLOYEES OF THE ORGANIZATION MEET THE CRITERIA TO BE CLASSIFIED AS OFFICERS OR KEY EMPLOYEES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST. THE ORGANIZATION'S GOVERNING DOCUMENTS AND CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY ARE NOT AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC.

IdRelatedOrgTxblCorpTrGrp.PrimaryActivitiesTxt: MANAGING MEMBER OF APOLLO THEATER LESSOR, LLC-SEE P III
